subject: Productivity
title: McClelland's Three Needs
description: Learn McClelland's Three Needs in one minute.

hook.text: David McClelland said every person is driven primarily by one of three needs: achievement, power, or affiliation.

buildup.text: Achievement-driven people want to excel. Power-driven people want influence. Affiliation-driven people want connection.

discovery.text: McClelland used the Thematic Apperception Test: people told stories about ambiguous pictures, revealing their drive.

twist.text: The best leaders need a specific blend: high power motivation, low affiliation need, and high self-control.

climax.text: Knowing your dominant need helps explain why some roles energize you and others drain you completely.

punchline.text: Know what drives you. Then choose work that feeds it.
